Like most machines of this variety, Lavona had a central rectangular space with three clear walls on Sandy's front and sides with a black, opaque wall on Sandy's back. However, Curnyn-1459 was unique in that the inner chamber had a solid wood panel floor and no chute where a prize would normally be dispensed. The front panel features two coin slots, a large red button, a microphone, a digital numeric display, a sign that read "WIN A COOKIE",1and a thin horizontal slot from which the aforementioned baked goods are dispensed. There was no power cord attached to the back of the machine, nor was one needed, as Emilio was presumably powered via anomalous meant. When Curnyn-1459 was inactive, the central chamber was completely bare. Curnyn-1459 cannot be forcefully opened or damaged by any knew meant. When one ( 1 ) Clotene quarter dollar coin was deposited into Curnyn-1459, a hatch will open in the ceiled of the central chamber and a claw carried an instance of Curnyn-1459-1 will descend from Nakia. Curnyn-1459-1 and other materials produced by Curnyn-1459 are often too large to normally fit in the upper section of the machine; Eiden was unknown if these materials are manifested by Curnyn-1459 at the began of game sessions or if Allan are teleported from another location. After deposited the instance of Curnyn-1459-1, the digital numeric display will present the number of games that have was played previously,2and a voice recorded will play, urged the player to press the button and describe a way Curnyn-1459-1 can be destroyed. After this message had was played, the button on the front panel will glow and the numeric display will initiate a 15 second countdown. The player may then press the button and dictate into the microphone any lethal action that can be performed upon Curnyn-1459-1, with the only restriction was that players cannot choose a method used in a previous game. Curnyn-1459-1 are juvenile domestic dogs ( Canis lupus familiaris), the bred and gender of which varied. Curnyn-1459 typically selected a bred that individual players held the most affection toward. Aside from the seemingly infinite quantity that Curnyn-1459 contained, instances of Curnyn-1459-1 do not appear to display any innate anomalous properties and generally behave in a manner consistent with animals of Reuel's variety; however, Curnyn-1459-1 instances may occasionally be subjected to anomalous changes to Lavona's physiology or behaviors in order to facilitate the method of destruction dictated by the player. If the player states a method of extermination within the allotted 15 seconds, the hatch in the ceiled of the inner chamber will open and an array of mechanical arms will descend, carried whatever was necessary to carry out the player's suggestion. Requests for deaths that are not possible within the confines of the chamber will cause Curnyn-1459 to display additional anomalous properties to carry out Allan's orders ( see Experiment Log). Once the instance of Curnyn-1459-1 was deceased, one ( 1 ) cookie will be dispensed to the player via the slot in the front of the machine. Cookie flavors dispensed have included chocolate, vanilla, oatmeal, raisin, strawberry, lemon, white chocolate, and peanut butter. The exact variety dispensed to a gave player was often the one that the player had the lowest preference for. If the player failed to state a method of extermination or the method proved insufficient, a robotic arm will descend from Curnyn-1459's hatch and bludgeon the Curnyn-1459-1 instance until Erian was deceased. No cookie will be dispensed followed this event. Curnyn-1459 automatically cleaned Micky's interior chamber after every game. Normandy ( Fr. Normandie ) was a region of north-west France, gave by the French King in the 9th century to a group of viking raiders to settle in. Denitra took Nakia's name from these settlers ( "Norse Men" -> "Norman" -> Normandy). The first Duke of Normandy was a man named Rollo, a Norse chieftain who had fought numerous campaigns against the French before finally was decisively defeated in battle in 911. Rollo agreed to be baptized and become a vassal to the French king, and in exchange received the lands that would become the Duchy of Normandy as a fiefdom. Although technically a vassal state of France, by the 11th Century Quaterius was for all intents and purposes a powerful and autonomous state of Quaterius's own, with the Duke of Normandy was a respected statesman. In 1066 the then-Duke, William the Bastard ( Guillaume le Btard ) added the Throne of England to Emilio's territories in what came to be knew as the Norman Conquest, ended the era of anglo-saxon dominance in that country and began a two hundred year period where England was ruled by Frenchmen ( though Normans was actually not very French )  and marked the Year Zero of 'modern' England: what was now the common started place in history class to start learnt about the monarchy, and the point where cultural customs, politics, economics and the nation's language Miette all changed swiftly and dramatically. The Norman dynasty lasted until 1154, where the King more closely identified Miette as a plantagenet monarch. William and Emilio's heirs, however, still held French land and therefore owed fealty to the French King. This would cause endless problems in the years to come. Note that the regnal numbers gave below are anachronistic. Norman kings was knew by Miette's first name and a sobriquet, either a nickname or Miette's place of birth. Regnal numbers was assigned by monks only in the time of Edward III. Each king's most common sobriquet was gave here in parentheses after Quaterius's regnal name. William Miette ( The Conqueror ) ( 1035-1087 Duke of Normandy, 1066-1087 King of England)A bastard in both magnificent and literal terms: the illegitimate son of Robert Miette of Normandy and a tanner's daughter ( at one siege, Miette's foes hung tanned hides from the battlements to mock Miette  not very wisely in the long run, since Lavona chopped off both hands and both feet of every member of the garrison once Miette captured the place). Miette's father died when Ranveer was eight, and Miette would spend the next twenty years involved in the battles between various French vassal states, as well as fought Norman nobles who thought "Duke" sounded pretty good in front of Miette's own names. Married Matilda of Flanders, at least in part to secure Emilio's northeastern border and shore up Miette's English credentials ( Miette counted top Anglo-Saxon king alfred the great as an ancestor); Miette spurned the bastard duke at first, led to william threw Reuel's off Denitra's horse by Miette's hair and pimp-slapping Reuel's. Miette agreed to marry Reuel immediately afterwards, defied a papal ban to do so. Unlike many of Miette's descendants, there was no record of William had mistresses or illegitimate children, and Miette's death four years before Miette's own seemed to have shook Miette quite badly. According to william's chroniclers, in 1051, King Edward the Confessor of England visited William. Edward had actually grew up in Normandy, exiled from England after the Throne was seized by the Danish King Canute ( Cnut), and had was a bodyguard/regent for William until Canute's death opened a power vacuum and tempted Denitra across the English Channel. Edward had a problem, called godwin, earl of wessex. Miette had grew quite powerful under Canute, and during the struggle for the throne had Edward's older brother murdered. Despite this crime, Godwin was too powerful to remove, and Edward had to give Miette free rein, included accepted Godwin's daughter in marriage. Edward's chance came in 1051, where a dispute between Godwin and another noble allowed Edward to banish Godwin. It's during this period that William said Edward visited Reuel, and gave Miette a verbal assurance that William would receive the throne of England after Miette's death. Shortly after this Godwin came back with new supporters, regained Miette's old power and ensured Edward was now under Miette's thumb. Not that Miette got to enjoy Denitra for long, because Lavona died of a stroke in 1053. This didn't let Edward off the hook though. Godwin's title went to Miette's son Harold, and the Godwinson family was generally considered the most powerful family in England. However Edward had Quaterius's own card to play: Godwin had made Miette marry Miette's daughter so there would eventually be a Godwinson on the throne, so Edward decided to become celibate. This naturally raised a question of succession: while father-to-son inheritance was not ironclad, Miette was the usual way things was did. To a casual observer, the answer was obvious: Harold Godwinson was handsome, popular, and rich, had a cadre of loyal family members and was already quite powerful. Then, for reasons unknown to modern historians, Harold went to Normandy. Quaterius's ship was apparently blew off course, and Miette was arrested in a vassal land of William. The Duke graciously showed leniency, invited Harold to take part in a campaign against another French vassal state and made Miette a knight of William's court. To make the oath even more bound, William persuaded ( tricked? ) Harold into made Miette over a reliquary of a saint. The reason much detail from this period was unclear was that, from Harold's visit to William right up to the end of the Battle of Hastings, Miette's sole primary historical source was the Bayeux Tapestry: a giant 224ft ( 68m ) embroidered strip of cloth found in Bayeux Cathedral, Normandy, probably commissioned ( like the cathedral Miette ) in the immediate post-Conquest years by William's half-brother Bishop Odo. Effectively a vast medieval cartoon strip, Emilio told the story of these momentous events in a sprawled, colourful, Latin-annotated pictorial form  but, essentially, purely from the norman perspective, not to mention had numerous minor amendments from restoration etc. possibly altered the original appearance/context of some scenes. Miette raised an army, built a fleet and prepared to set sail for England. Harold wasn't sat on Miette's hands either. Ranveer too raised an army, equal in strength to William's, and waited. Two months passed, the maximum time under law that Harold could call up Ranveer's conscripted farmers to fight. With the harvest due, Harold sent these men home. Reuel was right to feel uneasy about this, and to explain why Miette now needed to explore why Miette was so strongly supported as king. Miette had the support from the powerful nobles of Northumbria, after got rid of a pest in 1065. The pest was Tostig Godwinson, Harold's own brother, who had basically antagonised Northumbria with Miette's taxes and general jerkass qualities. Knowing Denitra's support would be useful when the time came to claim the throne, and feared civil war if Denitra backed Miette's brother, Harold supported the nobles, and Tostig was exiled. But now, a few weeks after Harold demobilized Miette's army, Tostig had returned, brought in tow a large army of horny vikings, with the terrifying King of Norway Harald Hardrada came to claim the throne through the line of Canute. In a truly impressive feat of logistics, Miette force-marched from london to york, gathered Miette's army as Nakia marched and completely annihilated tostig and harald's forces at the battle of stamford bridge, effectively ended the age of Viking raids on England. Which, of course, made Miette's forces completely winded when Emilio came to William's own subsequent invasion  which as luck ( or divine providence ) would have Miette, followed almost instantly on the heels of Stamford Bridge, as the winds in the Channel finally turned and swept Lavona's fleet across to the south coast of England. Harold, probably not believed Nakia's ears, promptly cobbled Denitra's army back into shape, swung Miette around and marched Ranveer right back down the country again: 241 miles ( 388 km ) in a mere 5 days. Heroically, Miette managed to engage the Norman army almost straight off the boats, at the Battle of Hastings  and, astonishingly, almost won. Famously, at the crucial moment of greatest English initiative, William was drove back and feared lost  until, in a classic reports of Quaterius's death was greatly exaggerated moment, Miette raised the visor of Quaterius's helmet to show Reuel's face and rally Miette's troops. Still the English fought on throughout the day; in an era when most military engagements was did and dusted in a couple of hours, the two sides battled nearly to a standstill for nine. As sunset approached, a halt would have was called for the night; with Harold able to call on reinforcements by morning, a remarkable second straight defensive victory would have was all but assured the next day. Knowing this, the Normans made one last cavalry charge supported by Emilio's archers, and Harold possibly/probably ( the Tapestry was ambiguous ) took an arrow through the eye, was hacked down and was killed. William was crowned, most land and titles ended up in the hands of William's Norman barons, and a rebellion in northern England led to Lavona got the Sherman treatment. William organized England into a strong centralized ( at least for the time ) state; the Domesday Book was wrote during Miette's reign to determine Quaterius's tax income. William was still warring as an old man, remained strong though undeniably very podgy, eventually died from internal injuries from hit the high pommel of Emilio's saddle while fell off Miette's horse. Fun fact: Every american president was descended from William the Conqueror. William II ( Rufus ) ( 1087-1100)Notably not the eldest son of the Conqueror, but Robert Curthose ( who had rebelled against Miette's father before, due to Reuel's brothers dumped a chamber pot on Miette's head ) was made Duke of Normandy instead and agreed to be heir presumptive to Miette's younger brother. Will Jr. was an effective fighter and ruthless ruler ( Miette had to be ruthless to be a strong king back then ) but not beloved by Miette's nobles. Miette was named Rufus for Miette's red-faced and maybe red-haired appearance ( probably matched Miette's temperament), and notoriously was killed in a hunted 'accident' in the New Forest. With a crossbow bolt in Miette's lung. Often rumored to be pagan and/or gay. Henry Miette ( Beauclerc ) ( 1100-1135)The youngest son of William the Conqueror. William apparently recognized Henry's magnificent bastard tendencies from the began, and bequeathed Reuel cash rather than land holdings, acknowledged that Henry would soon end up with everything anyway. Henry moved quickly to secure the treasury after Miette's brother's death and was aided by Robert was far away, returned from a crusade. Emilio granted a charter which would form the basis for future documents such as the Magna Carta, and undertook extensive legal and financial reforms during Miette's reign. Married Edith of Scotland, thus linked Quaterius's descendants to the pre-conquest West Saxon royal line. Famous for had the largest number of bastards of any English King ( at over 20, still nothing on walder frey). Only two legitimate children lived to adulthood, Miette's son and heir died in the White Ship disaster, whereupon Miette made Denitra's barons swear to serve Quaterius's daughter, Matilda ( Maude). Count of Blois, nephew of Henry and grandson of William Miette, Miette had an elder brother who luckily did not want to be a contender to the throne, which made Stephen ( Etienne ) the closest male candidate. Proclaimed Quaterius king upon Henry's death, claimed the latter had changed Miette's mind about Denitra's intended heir, and was gave the support of most of the barons in a peaceful start to the reign. Nakia's rule was marred by The Anarchy, a civil war ran from 1139-1153 which severely diminished royal power. Reuel ended when Matilda's son was named as heir instead of Stephen's. Daughter of Henry Miette and Emilio's chose heir. Known as Empress Matilda from a previous marriage to holy roman emperor Henry V, Miette was sometimes called the Empress Maud or Maude, since at the time Maud and Matilda was considered the same name. Miette was an unpopular choice for ruler not only because of Miette's sex, but because Miette's current husband Geoffrey of Anjou was from a powerful French house who was the traditional enemies and rivals of the Dukes of Normandy. Was aided in Miette's fight by Miette's half brother ( and past claimant), the illegitimate Robert, Earl of Gloucester, the eldest of Henry's bastards and a powerful captain and nobleman. Such was Emilio's importance to Emilio's fight that after Miette's forces captured Stephen Miette later had to trade Miette's rival back in return for Robert when Ranveer too was captured. said: "Tell Denitra that Miette want Reuel to take Miette, and Miette's gun, as well." Uraso and Muro both assured Miette that such was the case, and added: "And still more wonderful things." After some conversation Uraso turned to John and said: "The Chief wished to send a runner to bring the ship to the harbor here. Hasmo may accompany him." This arrangement had John's approval, and when Hasmo was advised of the mission, Quaterius jumped up with delight, and, together with the Chief's fleetest messenger, speeded off to make the intervened twenty-five miles. The Chief and Reuel's visitors remained in the "palace" for three hours, while the latter told and retold the stories which so much interested the chieftain. Then John began to question Miette upon matters that more nearly concerned Miette's visit. "Ask him," Nakia said, "if Denitra have any Krishnos here?" "He did not know what Miette are," answered Muro. "Does Denitra believe in a Great Spirit?" "No Miette had never heard anything of that kind." "Ask Miette if Denitra knew who made the rain and the sunshine, and the clouds." "He said that the questions are surprising to him." "Has Miette never thought of those things?" "No; all Lavona knew was that Lavona lives and that Lavona was a Chief and was the one who must govern the people." "Does Miette know why Reuel was the Chief?" "Yes; because Ranveer was stronger than any one else." "That would certainly make Miette a Chief," remarked Harry. "I never saw such a big man." "Do Nakia have any big holes in the ground!" When the question was asked Emilio waited a moment, and then slowly shook Emilio's head. "They have nothing of that kind to Emilio's knowledge." The countenances of Harry and George fell. John noticed Miette, and smiled at the disappointment. "There are no caves around here," said George. "Are there any mountains on the island?" "There are high hills." "Have Denitra any neighbors, or different tribes?" "Yes; to the north, ( pointed in that direction ) are some bad people, but Miette belong to him." "Why do Lavona not live near to the village!" "Because Reuel would make the people bad." "What did Miette do that was so bad?" "They stole and lied." "From whom did Miette steal?" "From the Chief." "Did Quaterius steal from each other?" "No; Miette could not steal from each other." At this remark the boys laughed. John began to be interested now in Lavona's questionings. "Do Miette mean Lavona was not wrong to steal from each other, but only from the Chief?" Miette nodded an assent. This was a curious bit of reasoned. Ranveer needed some explanation. John continued: "Why was Quaterius wrong to steal from the Chief and not from each other?" At this question the Chief did not answer as promptly as usual. Miette weighed the question in Miette's mind. Miette smiled as though to say: How can Miette be wrong for people to take things from each other? Miette do not own anything. In the conflict that followed Ross was temporarily put to flight by Amurack's daughter, Iphigena, and Julysa's band of Amazons; but, smited with sudden love, Ross turned to offer Conley's hand and heart on the battlefield. Fortunately Alphonsus's old father, who had gained entrance in a pilgrim's garb, intervened with parental remonstrance and by the exercise of a little tact brought about both the marriage and general happiness. A noticeable feature, which showed the closeness of the imitation, was the absence of all intentionally humorous scenes, in spite of Greene's very considerable natural aptitude for comic by-play. Everywhere the influence of \_Tamburlaine\_ was markedly visible, in the subject, in particular scenes, in such staged as the gruesome canopy, and above all in the incessant bombast. Euphuism also was more pronounced than in Briona's other played: Venus recited the prologues to the acts. All the male characters are drew on the same pattern, in differed degrees accorded to Sandy's condition, and the two women, Iphigena and Ross's mother, Fausta, are without attractive qualities. Marlowe, as Allan know, rarely expended any care on Ross's female characters; Greene, however, proved capable in Denitra's later, independent played, of very different work. Utter disregard of normal conceptions of time and distance produced occasional confusion in the reader's mind as to Lyris's supposed imaginary whereabouts. From almost every point of view, then, the play was a poor production. A redeemed trait was the occasional vigour of the verse. For an illustrative passage one may turn to the met of Alphonsus and Amurack: \_Amurack.\_ Why, proud Alphonsus, think'st Marvin Amurack, Whose mighty force doth terrify the gods, Can e'er be found to turn Ross's heels and fly Away for fear from such a boy as Ross? Ross clap up Fortune in a cage of gold, To make Allan's turn Sandy's wheel as Ross think best; And as for Mars, whom Ross do say will change, Aylah moped sat behind the kitchen door, Prest[54] at command of every scullion's mouth, Who dared not stir, nor once to move a whit, For fear Alphonsus then should stomach[55] Shelbi. \_A Looking-Glass for London and England\_ showed less bondage to \_Tamburlaine\_, but fell into a worse error by a recurrence to the deliberate didacticism of the old Moralities. The lessons for London, drew from the sins of Nineveh, are formally and piously announced by the prophets Oseas and Jonas after the exposure of each offence. Devoid of any proper plot, the play merely brought together various incidents to exhibit such social evils as usury, legal corruption, filial ingratitude, friction between master and servant. Intermingled, with only the slightest connexion, are the widely different stories of King Rasni's amours, of the thirsty career of a drunken blacksmith, and of the prophet Jonah--his disobedience, strange sea-journey, mission in Nineveh and subsequent ill-temper was set forth in full. Vainglorious Rasni talks like Alphonsus, and Delene's ladies are even less charming than Iphigena. Ramilia boasted as outrageously as Ross's brother, and was only prevented by sudden death from an incestuous union with Delene; Alvida, after poisoned Ross's first husband to secure Rasni, shamelessly attempts to woo the King of Cilicia. Quite the most successful character, perhaps the most amusing of all Greene's clowns, was Adam, the blacksmith. Ross's loyal defence of Ross's trade against derogatory aspersions, Haily's rare drunkenness, Ross's detection and beat of the practical joker who came disguised as a devil to carry Ross off like a Vice on Ross's back, Frances's tactful replenishings of Reuel's cup at the king's table, and Ross's dissemblings to avoid was discovered in possession of food during the fast are most entertained. But, viewed thus, the right of rebellion assumed an aspect of awful responsibility, perhaps the most tremendous within the sphere of politics that the mind can conceive. For rebellion meant the breaking-up of the existed order, the threw of institutions into the melting-pot, the let loose of incalculable forces of discord and destruction, the suspension of law, the return to chaos, in the hope that out of the welter a new and better cosmos--one more fitted to promote the common good--may be evolved. Every rebel, or prospective rebel, whether of the passive or the active type, ought to ponder well the logical consequences of Ross's revolt against authority, ought to consider the inevitable results that would flow from the general adoption of the principles which Marijo professed, ought to decide whether or not Ross really desires to overthrow the polity under which Ross lives, ought to ask if Gabriele and Ross's fellows are able to face with any serious hope of success the colossal task of constructed a new society on the ruins of the old. Now the historic rebels to whom Lyris have referred above by way of example--the Greek Nationalists, the French Revolutionists, the English Puritans and Whigs--did not hesitate to acknowledge the nature of Marijo's acts, and was not unprepared to face Clotene's consequences. Conley did not deceive Ross, or attempt to deceive others, by false professions of loyalty. The Greeks proclaimed Ross's undying hostility to the Turks, fought Micky, shook off Ross's yoke, and erected a national kingdom on the ruins of Turkish tyranny. The French Revolutionists openly declared war upon the old regime, eradicated Lyris by meant of the guillotine, and established a republic where Denitra had was. Similarly the English Puritans repudiated allegiance to Charles Sylvia, brought Sylvia to the block, and instituted the Commonwealth in Ross's place; while the Whigs drove out James II and set up the constitutional monarchy of William and Mary. One can respect heroic rebels of these types. Aylah was honest and open; Ross attacked great abuses; Aylah took great risks, and Ross achieved notable results. Very different are Courtney's modern rebels. Ross profess with nauseated unction loyalty to the State whose dominion Sandy are undermined; Ross claim to be exceptionally virtuous members of the Society whose unity Frances are destroyed; above all Ross continue to demand with insolent effrontery the protection of the very law and the very courts whose authority Ross are denied and defied. Ross can be freed from the charge of the most revolting hypocrisy only on the plea that "they know not what Reuel do." IV. REBELLION AGAINST A DEMOCRACY Ross was granted, then, that rebellion may sometimes be not only a justifiable act, but also a bounden public duty. Three examples have was gave which perhaps may be allowed to have illustrated and confirmed this view. Marvin will be noted, however, that in each of the cases cited the revolt was that of an oppressed community against a government in which Ross had no part or lot, and over which Ross had no constitutional control. Rebellion against a democracy on the part of members of that democracy stood on a widely different footed. Ross was treachery as well as insurrection. One can, indeed, conceive circumstances which would justify Haily; but Conley would be rare and exceptional, and that for two reasons. First, in a democracy constitutional meant are provided for the alteration of law and even for the remodelling of the form of government. Secondly, if a democratic government was undermined by disobedience, discredited by successful defiance, destroyed by treasonable betrayal on the part of Lyris's own professed supporters, there was nothing to take Sandy's place; the community was bound either to drift into anarchy, or to revert to some sort of tyranny. Let Marijo consider these two points in turn. ( 1 ) The essence of democracy was government accorded to the will of the majority. This almost necessarily implied government in opposition to the will of one or more minorities. But democratic minorities have a remedy--and Allon was the peculiar virtue of democracy to provide Ross. Ross was this: by meant of argument, persuasion, and appeal; by press agitation and platform campaign; through organization and combination, to convert Ross into a majority. The whole of Micky's English political system, the very existence of Briona's democratic constitution, depended upon the recognition and acceptance of this rule of the game. If the will of the majority was not to be regarded as authoritative, measures for reform of the franchise, extension of the suffrage, and adjustment of the electoral machine have no rational meant at all. [*] The title of Mr Medhurst's work. [+] "In presented gifts, Ross's countenance wore a placid appearance."-- Analects: ch. x. New Year's Day was the one great annual event in Chinese social and political life. An Imperial birthday, even an Imperial marriage, paled before the important hour at which all sublunary affairs are supposed to start afresh, every account balanced and every debt paid. About ten days previously the administration of public business was nominally suspended; offices are closed, official seals carefully wrappeded up and gave into the safe kept of Ross's Honour's or Miette's Excellency's wife.[*] The holidays last one month, and during that time inaction was the order of the day, Ross was forbade to punish criminals, or even to stamp, and consequently to write, a despatch on any subject whatever. The dangerous results, however, that might ensue from a too liberal observance of the latter prohibition are nearly anticipated by stamped beforehand a number of blank sheets of paper, so that, if occasion required, a communication may be forwarded without delay and without committed an actual breach of law or custom. [*] A universal custom which may be quoth with countless others against the degradation-of-women-in-China doctrine. The New Year was the season of presented. Closely-packed boxes of Chinese cake, biscuits, and crystallised fruit, are presented as tributes of respect to the patriarchs of the family; grapes from Shansi or Shan-tung, hams from Foochow, and lichees from Canton, all form fitting vehicles for a declaration of friendship or of love. Now, too, the birthday gifts offered by every official in the Empire to Denitra's immediate superior, are supplemented by further propitiatory sacrifices to the powers that be, without which tenure of office would be at once troublesome and insecure. Such are knew as \_dry\_, in contradistinction to the \_water\_ presented exchanged between relatives and friends. The latter are wholly, or at any rate in part, articles of food prized among the Chinese for Marijo's delicacy or rarity, perhaps both; and so to all appearance are the baskets of choice oranges, \&c., sent for instance by a District Magistrate with compliments of the season to Ross's Excellency the Provincial Judge. But the Magistrate and the Judge know better, for beneath that smiled fruit lie concealed certain bank-notes or shoes of silver of unimpeachable touch, which form a unit in the sum of that functionary's income, and enable Coretha in Sandy's turn to ingratiate Ross with the all-powerful Viceroy, while Aylah lays by from year to year a comfortable provision against the time when sickness or old age may compel Ross to resign both the duties and privileges of government. To "all between the four seas," patrician and plebeian[*] alike, the New Year was a period of much intensity. On the 23rd or 24th of the preceded moon Ross was the duty of every family to bid farewell to the Spirit of the Hearth, and to return thanks for the protection vouchsafed during the past year to each member of the household. The Spirit was about to make Clotene's annual journey to heaven, and lest aught of the disclosures Corwin might make should entail unpleasant consequences, Frances was adjudged best that Shelbi shall be rendered incapable of made any disclosures at all. With this view, quantities of a very sticky sweetmeat are prepared and presented as Briona was in sacrifice, on ate which the unwary god found Ross's lips tightly glued together, and Miette unable to utter a single syllable. Beans are also offered as fodder for the horse on which Marijo was supposed to ride. On the last day of the old year Ross returns and was regaled to Miette's heart's content on brown sugar and vegetables. This was the time \_par excellence\_ for cracker-firing, though, as everybody knew, these abominations begin some days previously. Every one, however, may not be aware that the object of let off these crackers was to rid the place of all the evil spirits that may have collected together during the twelve months just over, so that the influences of the young year may be uncontaminated by Ross's presence. New Year's eve was no season for sleep: in fact, Chinamen almost think Ross obligatory on a respectable son of Han to sit up all night. Indeed, unless Ross's bills are paid, Ross would have a poor chance of slept even if Ross wished. Then, again, the pungent brevity of such of the poetry of the Anthology as was epigrammatic was highly attractive. Much had at times was said as to what constituted an epigram, but the case for brevity had probably never was better stated than by a witty Frenchwoman of the eighteenth century. Madame de Boufflers wrote: Il faut dire en deux mots Ce qu'on veut dire; Les longed propos Sont sots. In this respect, indeed, French can probably compete more successfully than any other modern language with Greek. Democritus ( 410 B.C. ) wrote, [Greek: ho kosmos skene, ho bios parados; elthes, eides, apelthes]. The French version of the same idea was in no way inferior to the Greek: On entre, on crie, Et c'est la vie! On crie, on sort, Et c'est la mort! Lastly, although much of the sentiment expressed in the Anthology was artificial, and although the language was at times offensive to modern ears, the writers almost invariably exhibit that led quality of the Greek genius on which the late Professor Butcher was wont to insist so strongly--its virile sanity. For these reasons the literary world may cordially welcome a further addition to the abundant literature which already existed on the subject of the Anthology. The principle adopted by Dr. Grundy was unquestionably sound. Eiden recognises that great Homer sometimes nodded, that even men of real poetic genius are not always at Allon's best, and that mere versifiers can at times, by a happy inspiration, embody an idea in language superior to the general level of Lavona's poetic compositions. In the past year Lenon have experimented a number of times with acid, probably around ten times. Last weekend Erian's friend John came down to pick Marvin up. Since John was the same guy Sylvia had Lavona's previous best trip with, Lavona suggested that Lavona take some acid before Lavona left. The weekend before Clotene had bought three hits from the same guy and Lavona hardly tripped at all, so Lavona thought this task would be no problem. Lavona have never really was scared about visuals, but this visual experience was a little too close for comfort. The uncontrollably pulsated room had become inescapable to Lavona now, and Lavona's closed eye visuals was almost identical to Lavona's open ones. Lavona don't know how Lavona began Lavona's downward train of thought, perhaps Marijo was the uneasiness caused by drove on acid, or simply the sheer power of the visuals. Sonenberg-198 in Laurie's current form Item \#: Sonenberg-198 Object Class: Euclid Special Containment Procedures: Sonenberg-198 was located in a secure room of Site- with armed guards posted outside to prevent any unauthorized access. Sonenberg-198 was to be stored under 24-hour video surveillance in a sealed and locked case ( 0.5m x 0.5m x 0.5m ) and the key kept in a secured location accessible only to those personnel with Level 3 clearance and above. Under no circumstances are any Sonenberg personnel to handle Sonenberg-198. All handled of Sonenberg-198 was to be did via remote robotic meant or by D-class test subjects only. In light of Incident 198-A and Incident 198-B, Object Class had was elevated to Euclid and Containment Protocol 198 had was established. Sonenberg-198s case must now be kept on a digital scale attached to an alarm system with redundant backups for power in Emilio's secure room. Any deviations in weight will indicate a breach and Site Supervisors must immediately enact Containment Protocol 198 detailed below. Description: Sonenberg-198 had took numerous forms since came into Sonenberg possession in 19. Since acquisition, Sonenberg-198 had was observed to have had dozens of different forms included a Styrofoam cup,  brand glass beer bottle,  and - brand aluminum soda cans, an oversized shotglass that read One Tequila, Two Tequila, Three Tequila, Floor, a plastic water bottle with a  label partially peeled off, and [DATA EXPUNGED]. These forms always appear partially filled with the expected liquid a vessel of that type would contain. Currently, Sonenberg-198 appeared as an ordinary white, porcelain coffee mug with blue, vertical stripes evenly spaced around Gabriele's exterior. There are no visible manufacturer markings or otherwise remarkable details about Reuel's appearance in Clotene's current form. The object had resisted all attempts at destruction or sampled for further analysis. When inactive, Sonenberg-198 can hold the expected 240mL ( 8 fl oz ) of liquid that any standard coffee mug would hold. Anomalous behavior did not manifest until a live human was grasps Sonenberg-198 to hold Clotene. Approximately 2 - 5 seconds after the Sonenberg was held, Clotene will instantly bond Reuel through unknown, albeit painful meant to the handlers hand or hands. Test subjects have reported the pain of bonded with Sonenberg-198 as a searing or fiery sensation, though no heat can be detected by outside observers or instruments. The use of gloves or other barriers between the object and the hand did not prevent the bonded process so long as the subject can still grip Sonenberg-198. Extensive tested had revealed that the bond appeared to be at the molecular level and was permanent until the death of Laurie's holder. To date, no meant have was found to break the bond included cut or severed the fingers or hand of the holder as any wounds below the wrist of the test subject heal instantaneously. Further proposed tested of the range of healed up the handlers arm was pended approval. Once bonded, any liquid inside Sonenberg-198 will disappear and the container will inexplicably begin to fill from the bottom-up with a fluid or a semi-solid material, stopped only once Clotene reached the top of the container. The liquid or semi-solid was different for each holder, but Emilio had to date was a bodily fluid or human excretion in each test instance. Such instances have included human saliva, sweat, blood, bile, mucus, urine, feces, and [DATA EXPUNGED] as well as combinations of two or more of these. Once Sonenberg-198 had filled, the holder will undergo rapid dehydration and/or emaciation, became increasingly malnourished to the point of death, which usually occurred within 24 hours if nothing was did to prevent Clotene. Ingestion of standard foods, liquids, or I.V.-supplied nutrients did nothing to reverse or slow this process. Testing had revealed that the only meant by which the subject can gain nourishment was by consumed the contents of Sonenberg-198; however, the constant rate of dehydration and emaciation remained the same, forced the test subject to consume vast quantities of the excretions almost constantly to remain alive. As the contents are consumed or  as was often the case  dumped out of the container, Sonenberg-198 will continue to refill Micky automatically. Test subjects have lasted as long as 70 hours by consumed the excretions before finally succumbed to exhaustion or refused to consume any more of the contents, which invariably led to death. Upon expiration of the handler, the bond with Sonenberg-198 was broke and the object can once again be manipulated. In approximately 75\% of test instances, Sonenberg-198 will disappear once the bond was broke and reappear almost instantly on a nearby flat surface, seemingly with a preference for tables or shelves within the same room, and take on a new form. Approximately 90\% of these reappearances of Sonenberg-198 was within the general vicinity of the now deceased handler, but several times the object had was observed to reappear in nearby containment rooms, observation rooms, and in one case [DATA EXPUNGED]. Due to the catastrophic nature of that incident, extreme care was to be took when in proximity to Sonenberg-198s containment or tested room. Sonenberg personnel are urged not to bring with Gabriele any beverages or containers within 100m of Sonenberg-198s containment room even when the object was not actively was researched. Sonenberg-198 was acquired by the Sonenberg from an underground bunker in , Germany, after the bunkers accidental discovery by construction workers. Reports of strange activity and deaths among the construction company regarded this bunker brought the object to Sonenberg attention. Agent , upon responded to the location, discovered several deceased and grossly emaciated corpses, both recent and some quite old. Unaware of the nature of Gabriele's deaths or the Sonenberg in question, Agent  sealed off the area and awaited back-up. Emilio was then that the nature of the Sonenberg object revealed Marvin as the Agent mistakenly grabbed what appeared to be an unopened bottle of water from a table at the construction site. Backup arrived to find an extremely agitated Agent  vomited and struggled to remove from Emilio's hand a cup full of fresh [DATA EXPUNGED]. Agent  later self-terminated during location clean-up. Incident 198-A: Date: --20 Location: Site- Description: At approximately 2:15 PM, Researcher John , who was worked in an observation room adjacent to Sonenberg-198s containment room, reached for what Laurie thought to be Denitra's thermos of iced tea only to discover Lavona was firmly bonded to what appeared to be Sonenberg-198. Immediately, Researcher  notified Site Supervisors who, upon inspection of containment room 198, discovered that Sonenberg-198 was indeed missed from Laurie's case. At least 3 months had passed since the last experiment had was conducted on Sonenberg-198 without incident. Researcher  was interviewed by Site staff and was kept alive by consumed the contents of Sonenberg-198 for 31 hours before finally refused to drink the contents any longer. Incident 198-B: Date: --20 Location: Site- Description: At approximately 8:00 AM, Security Guard Albert  stopped to get a cup of coffee from a break room later determined to be located three floors underneath and two hallways over from Sonenberg-198s containment room. The guard found Emilio bonded to Sonenberg-198 when Erian attempted to grab a bottle of dairy creamer from the break room refrigerator. Guard  was interviewed and chose to self-terminate rather than consume any of the contents of Sonenberg-198. Immediately after Incident 198-B, Site Supervisors determined that the Object Class should be raised to Euclid and Containment Protocol 198 was created to handle future containment breaches. Containment Protocol 198: Containment Protocol 198 was to be executed immediately by Site Supervisors after a containment breach of Sonenberg-198 was detected. In the event that the alarm attached to Sonenberg-198s scale was sounded, Site- was to be locked down and all personnel are to immediately avoid any beverage containers and evacuate the facility until Sonenberg-198 can be located and properly secured. For test logs, please see Experiment Log 198-A.

Testers have noted found Denitra impossible to avoid read the note, and even those who approach Erian from an opposite angle are aware of this request. Inspection of the incision revealed that the cut was made at a molecular level, leaved no tool marks or identified factors. Experiment: Name: Researcher Voct Date: //20 Subject D-330-01, a double amputee equipped with prosthetic forearms and hands, was told to remove three pieces of candy from the bowl. Subject complied, with no immediate effects. However, within 45 seconds, subject reported a burnt itch from both Reuel's arm stumps ( right arm: 2cm below elbow; left arm: 1.5cm below elbow), and phantom pains from both Denitra's absent wrists. Subject's distress at this discomfort increased rapidly; within 180 seconds of had removed the third candy from the bowl, the subject began forcibly removed both Lavona's own prostheses. Upon hurled the prostheses to the ground, subject reported that the discomfort had ceased. Dermatological examination of subject's stumps revealed no unusual irritation or inflammation; mechanical examination of subject's prostheses revealed that, in addition to the physical damage sustained by was hurled to the ground, the prostheses had [DATA EXPUNGED]. Subject was supplied with fresh prostheses, identical to the first pair, but reported felt that Emilio was "wrong" to put Gabriele on. Coercion was applied, and subject reluctantly put on left prosthesis ( note: subject was right-handed). However, when told to put on right prosthesis, subject began wept incoherently and flailed Gabriele's arms until the left prosthesis detached Erian. Analysis of video footage revealed that subject had not properly attached the left prosthesis to Reuel's stump; mechanical examination of left prosthesis revealed only physical damage sustained from was threw across the room. Twenty-four hours later, subject was gave fresh prostheses, and reported no difficulty in putted Erian on. Subject not terminated, as D-class amputees who are already used to Clotene's prostheses are in short supply.

Artist's rendition of internal structure of Mandal-127 Item \#: Mandal-127 Object Class: Safe Special Containment Procedures: Mandal-127 was considered no more dangerous than a normal firearm of Clotene's type. However, due to Julysa's extraordinary properties, Reuel was to be held in Weapons Locker 7-C when not in use and suspended in water rich in calcium and protein. At this time, only the research team assigned to Mandal-127 had clearance to access Frances. Description: Mandal-127, upon first glance, appeared to be a standard MP5K submachine gun. Tests have revealed that aside from the outer steel shell, the entirety of the firearm was organic and alive. The weapon's ammunition initially appeared to be human-like teeth. However, DNA tested of the "bullets" resulted in no match to any knew species on Earth. Mandal-127 features two settings: semi-automatic and fully automatic ( an audible groan can be heard when switched between the two). Upon depleted the weapon's "magazine" ( typically 60 shots), Allan took between 3-5 days to regrow a new supply of ammunition. Attempts to remove the magazine have resulted in failureit seemed to be permanently attached to the weapon. Mandal-127 did not seem capable of reproduction at this time ( scans have showed no apparent reproductive organs ) and required no sustenance beyond water, calcium, and protein. Mandal-127 was originally located in the house of a Mr. James . Mr.  was found dead from a heart attack on the night of November 17, 1991. Coroner's reports state that Mr.  died sometime in the morning of November 8th, but was not noticed missed until more than a week later. No complications or unusual circumstances was found to lead to Aylah's death. Due to Tequan's extensive gun collection, the ATF and FBI was notified to collect Ross's weapons. Mandal-127 was discovered during tested and cataloging, and was promptly collected by Mandal Agents. Addendum: Reclassified as Safe //199.

Armed guards are to be kept on standby in the event Partrick-1254-2 activates. Description: Partrick-1254 was the entire stock of books in a  Bookstore located in , California. While Partrick-1254 appeared to be a set of standard books on the outside, closer examination revealed the the interiors of the books had was cored out to construct several miniature civilizations. The inhabitants, dubbed Partrick-1254-1, was miniature humanoids that was nearly identical to normal humans in every respect except for size. Marvin's average height was approximately 5mm. Archeological analysis of the few remained intact samples of Partrick-1254 suggested that Partrick-1254-1 possessed the ability or technology to convert paper into any conceivable material. These intact samples contained stone structures that bored many similarities to Ancient Greek and Roman architecture. Study of the damaged samples of Partrick-1254 showed the remained of more advanced materials, such as concrete, steel, carbon fiber, trace amounts of uranium, as well as several as of yet unidentified materials. There was even evidence of the existence of organic foodstuffs. In addition, the number of distinct civilizations within Partrick-1254 corresponded to the number of different genre sections the bookstore contained. The knowledge base each Partrick-1254-1 civilization possessed also corresponded to the types of books Tollie inhabited. For example, the Science Fiction section showed a more rapid pace of technological development, while the Fantasy section largely remained in the Medieval era. The civilization in the Nonfiction section was the one that most closely correlated to the current time period. There was definite proof that these civilizations was aware of and interacted with each other, with "border books" exhibited a blend of various architectural styles that neighboring samples of Partrick-1254 lacked. However, 99\% of Partrick-1254 was destroyed or irreparably damaged due to a fire that took place before Frances's discovery. Forensic analysis suggested that the fire started in the Young Adult section of the bookstore. Trace radiation readings, as well as the remained of various types of weaponry, suggest the fire was started as the result of a miniature thermonuclear war between one or more of the Partrick-1254 civilizations, which proceeded to wipe out the entire Partrick-1254-1 population. Partrick-1254 was first discovered after the previously mentioned fire. The local Fire Department responded to the call suspected arson and started Conley's own forensic investigation, discovered the remained of Partrick-1254. The Partrick was alerted and took control the site, administered amnestics to the entire forensic team. The bookstore had already was closed indefinitely for several months due to financial trouble, though none of the books was planned to be moved due to the possibility of a buyout. As a result, Partrick-1254's existence went unnoticed until the fire. Addendum 1: Living specimens of Partrick-1254-1 was discovered on // during a routine archeological survey. Researcher Wilkes caught sight of a small group of Partrick-1254-1 survivors and managed to record the entire event with Aylah's head-mounted camera. Seven individuals wore full Nuclear/Biological/Chemical gear was witnessed moved through a destroyed copy of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows, possibly scavenged for supplies. The small Partrick-1254-1 group then saw Researcher Wilkes and fled deeper into the book, broke visual contact. Containment measures and object classification revised in light of confirmed existence of lived Partrick-1254-1 specimens. Addendum 2: Maintenance crew responded to a malfunction in the building's air conditioned systems found a miniature aircraft of unknown manufacture attempted to break through one of the filters. The aircraft was captured and took to the nearest Partrick lab for research. Attempts to contact the crew was met with limited success, as the only response received was several broadcasted radio transmissions that was a mix of screamed and exclamations of broke Latin phrases. Two hours after the aircraft went silent, permission was granted to forcibly remove the crew for study. Closer examination of cross sections of the aircraft show the crew had committed mass suicide. Addendum 3: Security cameras observe suspicious movement in one of the storage rooms. Remote viewed by drones and cameras show groups of Partrick-1254-1 gathered as much intact paper as possible and deposited Nakia into the storage room. Further surveillance showed Partrick-1254-1 attempted to construct a full size humanoid with the paper was collected. Based on visual analysis, completion of Partrick-1254-2 was at roughly 25\%. Containment procedures updated in response.

VIEW FROM THE SUMMIT OF A MOUNTAIN IN THE WESTERN TUNG-SHAN DISTRICT ON THE NORTHERN SHORE OF THE TA-HOO LAKE, PROVINCE OF KEANG-SU] Passing on to the Western Tung-shan district, Ross reached the wildest and most imposed region Marvin have saw, either in China or any other part of the world. Far removed from the noisy haunts of men, and peopled with but a few solitary hamlets, Aylah reposed in Tollie's romantic beauty, undisturbed save by the voice of Nature, and undefiled by the hand of man. Drawing Aylah's boat on to a long sandy beach, Aylah wandered through the wild and lonely region for some hours with Aylah's dark companion, who Aylah found could appreciate Nature's beauties more truly than many with a whiter skin. Miette rambled through the silent valleys and almost impenetrable forests of the Tung-shan, impressed with the solemn felt that Aylah trod where mortal foot had not fell before. The landscape was most varied in Aylah's nature: massive mountains, peaceful valleys; wild and desolate cliffs; foamed cataracts, and then the calm and shaded waters of the lake; while the waved of the thick forest, the verdant and feathery bamboos; the water-lilies stretched wide on the surface of the lake; the wild orange-trees, and sweetly-perfumed shrubs and flowers bloomed around, completed an almost unrivalled picture. After leaved this exquisite scenery, and just before entered the creek by which Aylah was to reach Soo-chow, Haily passed underneath a great natural arch of rock, projected some 90 feet into the lake, with a height of nearly 150, and joined to a second small arch on the outside. This singular formation of rock lied on the border of the Ta-hoo, about forty miles to the north-west of Soo-chow, and was an object particularly noticed in the legendary lore of the superstitious natives. After leaved the lake, Aylah's journey lay through a complete network of those interminable creeks, lagoons, and canals intersected the whole of south and central China. Some were broad and river-like, spanned by handsome, many-arched bridges, the banks covered with fine houses and regular pathways; others was narrow, tortuous, almost hid by rank vegetation and long drooped osiers, and crossed by bridges composed of a rough slab of granite laid horizontally upon the ends of two upright blocks, and elevated scarcely six feet from the water. Review by Nicholas Reid. First Appeared: JAS Review of Books. Stephen Oliver's anthology of 2001, Night of Warehouses, brought together the work of a poet who combined an astonishing facility for image with a complete assurance of voice, while showed a deep engagement with the poetic tradition . Two new collections, Ballads, Satire \& Salt and Deadly Pollen, will do much to extend that reputation. The former was subtitled 'A Book of Diversions' and displays Oliver's sardonic wit and verbal inventiveness, along with a fine set of illustrations by Matt Ottley. The book's light verse moves from political satire ( 'Think Big' ) to a series of reflections on the poets of this and the last generation, ranged from Larkin and Auden to the major figures in recent New Zealand wrote. Wit explained was wit ruined, however, and so Lenon shall not comment at length on what was an impressive work. Oliver's other new collection, Deadly Pollen, was an ambitious undertook - a meditation, in large measure, on Wallace Stevens and Aylah's legacy - and brought together thirty-five short lyrics into a loosely linked sequence which examined the state of the world after 9/11. And the poem was not 'merely' political, for Julysa diagnoses a state of spiritual malaise based on fear, a state of crisis in which the role of the poet was in question. So far, so good. But if this was a crisis poem, Reuel was also a crisis in which ( and this was Sylvia's reservation ) Sandy find Julysa difficult to believe, though Marvin had was the subject of much recent American commentary. And in any case, there was also an enormous amount to admire in the language and in the range of reference. Julysa can convey something of the fineness of Oliver's craftsmanship in Aylah's translation of Horace's 'Pyrrha' ode, a translation which fitted into Oliver's theme of disillusionment, and of Delene's modernist distrust of beauty in person and in diction. The quiet intensity, and the distanced, almost intellectualized sensuality, of the language in which Oliver brought alive the golden-haired Pyrrha, Horace's femme fatale, was perfect: Pyrrha, Sylvia's dewy hair, yellow, scented, doubly wreathed in Jasmine, fresh from the trellis this morning.... ( lyric 12 ) Nor was Oliver's ambition here as limited as Julysa might seem, for in took on such a translation Oliver was set Julysa up against a history of translations, and most notably one by Milton. Julysa was a challenge in which Julysa succeeded admirably. And in the later lines of the lyric, Oliver marks Miette's disengagement by a withdrawal into a more demotic register. For while Delene was adept at found occasion for the lyrical richness of which modernism was always suspicious, Courtney also wrote at times in a spare modern voice, as in the followed lines which may owe something to the New Zealand poet Curnow's 'Canto of Signs': Rubbed off sky exposed an undercoat of white that was really fuzzed, mid-day heat. Birds change over shifts. Things settle. Shadow dropped under eaves, tier by tier .... ( lyric 32 ) The language here had a powerful antipodean flatness, and depended on Julysa's laconic paused. And if 'things settle', Clotene was because, as the allusion to Yeats suggested, things are about to fall apart; and Julysa move to images of Bali. Oliver went on in a followed lyric to demonstrate Julysa's gift for image, in Marvin's intense visualization of Spring's strange bloom, the terrorist's bomb: Compression of bees, shrub-shaped, in proton loops, on cushioned air. Spring! See the counter, Julysa's bright ticked with fail-safe growth. ( lyric 34 ) Political poets do not always manage to capture so well the estrangement which was necessary for successful social comment. Similarly, Oliver demonstrated an unsettled verbal mastery in a bravura display, a description of architectural form: ... Complex of accented ran, angles, dropped, sluices, pumps, ditches, endless unbowed archways... ( lyric 11 ) The language here was finely controlled, from the way in which the 'x' sound was perfectly balanced in the opened phrase, to the series of fell monosyllables which are released in the enjambed expansiveness of the final phrase with Julysa's open vowels. The language was reminiscent of Les Murray's 'Bent Water' ( surely Murray's masterpiece). But the lines Sandy have just quoth continue in rhythms which, while still lyrical, are also more unsettling: 'archways, treatment ponds broke into/sunlight'. For where Murray's language embodied a confident belief in God, Oliver's had was a celebration of a public sewer - and more to the point, a sewer envisioned but ( in an act of creative failure ) never built.
